title: Conor McGregor announces UFC return for January 18 in Las Vegas
text:
Identity of his opponent is as of yet unknown but he 'does not give a f***'

Irishman has revealed he will return to octagon on January 18 in Las Vegas

Conor McGregor has been out of action since losing to Khabib Nurmagomedov

Conor McGregor has announced that his long-awaited return to action in the UFC will be on January 18 next year.

The Irishman will be fighting in Las Vegas and has not stepped into the cage since losing to Khabib Nurmagomedov in the same location last October.

In a press conference provocatively held in Nurmagomedov's native Russia, the 'Notorious' said: 'I am going to go through the entire roster like a chainsaw through butter.'

Conor McGregor will be returning to action on January 18 next year after a long lay-off

The Irishman vowed to 'Go through the entire roster like a chainsaw through butter'

A rematch with Khabib, who has since defended the lightweight title against Dustin Poirier is expected to be made at some point.

And McGregor took aim at his bitter rival. 'It will happen. I am not waiting around for that man, he is a known pull-out,' he added.

'You can run but you cannot hide. He ran out of the press conference in Moscow last week. It is in his nature. Trust me I am coming for him.

'Where is he now in this country? I fly in, he flies out. Typical.'

McGregor has plans to return to the gym soon to begin his preparations for comeback fight

McGregor hasn't fought since being choked out by Khabib at the T-Mobile Arena last October

McGregor has also expressed a desire to face the winner of next month's blockbuster showdown between Jorge Masvidal and Nate Diaz.

The Irishman does not yet know the identity of his opponent, saying: 'I don't give a f*** who it is,' but revealed his immediate plans to return to the gym and begin his preparations.

He added: 'The fight is 12 weeks this Saturday. I go into camp from this tour and you will not see me until I go to fight.

'My family motivates and inspires me. I want to show them what hard work can do.'
description: Conor McGregor (pictured today) has announced that his long-awaited return to action in the UFC will be on January 18 next year. He doesn't know his opponent yet but took aim at Khabib on Thursday.
